div.pre: 1916 Ionian Shore, Bruttium, 1908 (186) Burial: c. 360 B.C. (Vlasto); 375-70 (K) Contents: AR Taras: many st. (to Per. III, K1 /dc) Metapontum: many st. (incl. a few Noe 423 fdc) Thurium: many st. (incl. a few signed Molossus) Croton: many st. Terina: a few st. Corcyra: very many st. (100 ?; as J. Hirsch Nov. 9, 1910, 381-4) Pegasi ( Corinth ANS 1944.100.36709 ANS 1944.100.36883 ANS 1944.100.36885 ANS 1944.100.36703 ANS 1944.100.36706 ANS 1944.100.36720 ANS 1944.100.36727, Leucas ANS 1944.100.19204 ANS 1955.54.143 ANS 1955.54.142 ANS 1944.100.19207, Ambracia ANS 1944.100.18655 ANS 1957.172.769 ANS 1944.100.18634): a few (Vlasto); a great many (Hirsch) Disposition: Vlasto 9 (Cat. 243 [= J. Hirsch Nov. 9, 1910, 19], 280, 292, 350, 375, 380 [= J. Hirsch Nov. 9, 1910, 25], 413-5); New York 19-21 (1 Taras: ,SNG 860; 3 Thurium: SNG 992, 1035, 1043; 1 Corcyra?; 6-7 Corinth: R. 301, 306?, 309, 346, 370, as 972, 974; 6-7 Leucas: BMC 31 [= J. Hirsch May 23, 1910, 524]?, 33, 35, 38, 39, 42 [2]; 2 Ambracia: R. 52, 95 Vlasto, NNM 15 (1922), pp. 204-5 Kraay, ANSMN 16 (1970), pp. 23-30 (for details of Pegasi) The Vlasto Cat. records the above coins as from the Taranto 1908 hd. (Noe 1051 = no. 2000); that hd., however, contained nothing but Taras, Per. VIII. Nos. 413-5 are recorded as from "the 1908 Taranto find (Ionian Shore find). Noe 1051." It is evident that there is a confusion between two finds made in the same year, but concealed at very different dates In his copy of J. Hirsch May 23, 1910 Evans noted "Hirsch Find" against Thurium nos. 281, 285-91, 294, 296 and Corcyra no. 496
